The Attorney General must conduct a wholesale review of Trump‚Äôs politicization of the DOJ.

From intervening to help the President‚Äôs friends, to targeting the press and his political enemies.

Americans need to know how deep the problem ran, and what‚Äôs being done to fix it. https://t.co/LiVNJDCCsH

Wishing a very happy Father's Day to all the dads out there, and especially to my 93-year-old father, Ed. Because of COVID, I went more than a year without seeing him in person.
¬†
Here's hoping this holiday and the year ahead brings many joyful reunions for you and your families! https://t.co/mnwvEXkNo6

It‚Äôs never easy to lose such a wonderful companion. Thinking of the Bidens today.

We lost Mia at age 13 too. And the one positive from the pandemic was getting to spend so much time with her before she passed.

For all those with furry friends at home, cherish the time you have. https://t.co/QQ5gT9ECaQ https://t.co/7q0WfHtkL3

Juneteenth should be a national holiday.
 
That‚Äôs why I was proud to vote for the bill to officially designate it as such.
 
As America grapples with systemic racism, a holiday commemorating the delayed promise of freedom is an important milestone.

Between 2019-2020, 83,095 Americans were killed by guns.

In that same time, the NRA spent $5,420,000 lobbying to block gun safety. That's $65 per life.

And 2021 has already been the deadliest year on record.

Isn‚Äôt it time Republicans value our lives more than NRA money?

Health care is a human right, not a privilege for those who can afford it.
 
The Supreme Court‚Äôs decision to uphold the Affordable Care Act, including protections for those with pre-existing conditions, is a BFD.
 
The work to make health care universal goes on.

For far too long, presidents of both parties have relied on outdated war authorizations, decades after they were passed.
 
That must change, and it will. I just voted to end the 2002 authorization.
 
The responsibility to authorize war is a grave one, but it rests with Congress.

It's time we set a new tone in our relationship with Russia.
¬†
America is once again a strong, steadfast force for human rights and democracy around the world.
¬†
And the days of turning a blind eye to Putin's many abuses are over.

Trump made no secret of his demands that DOJ investigate his perceived political enemies. Including me.

He shattered post-Watergate norms. He politicized our justice system. And endangered our democracy.

We must restore DOJ‚Äôs independence. And we will. 
https://t.co/ESD7GkQAnK

Science works. Public health guidance works.
¬†
Vaccines work‚Äî and more than 40 million doses have been administered.
¬†
Welcome back, California.

We need a full accounting of the Trump DOJ‚Äôs abuse of power targeting Congress and the press.

An IG investigation is just the start.

The full range of the misconduct must be examined, including Barr‚Äôs efforts to protect those who lied to cover up, and go after Trump‚Äôs enemies.

Trump repeatedly demanded the DOJ go after his political enemies.

It's clear his demands didn't fall on deaf ears.
¬†
This baseless investigation, while now closed, is yet another example of Trump's corrupt weaponization of justice.

And how much he imperiled our democracy.

Too many billionaires pay $0 ‚Äì yes, zero ‚Äì in taxes, while millions of Americans struggle to pay their taxes and provide for their families.
¬†
That‚Äôs not right.¬†

Everyone needs to pay their fair share, so our country can prosper. Everyone.

Separating families doesn‚Äôt secure the border. It only inflicts lifelong trauma on children and families.

That nearly 4,000 children were torn from their parents will be an enduring stain on America's legacy.

We must do all we can to reunite them. https://t.co/kc9OsmQgag

There are too many open questions about Jan. 6:

What happened in the run-up to the insurrection? What intelligence was missed and why?

What lies fueled the violence? What did Trump do that day? What didn‚Äôt he do?

We need a full accounting and investigation. One way or another.

The quid pro quo was always clear.

And as we told the Senators, the truth would continue to come out.¬†

More to the point, we warned of the damage he would do if left in office.¬†

To think of the hardship we might have avoided. If they had listened. https://t.co/pAWzEwFijO

That is an insult to all families and communities torn apart by gun violence and those who have lost loved ones.

It must not be allowed to stand.

Trump and his allies in Congress want you to forget:
¬†
They took action after action to undermine our democracy, subvert the vote, and overturn the results of a free and fair election.‚Ä®

We won't let them. https://t.co/Uvelk9kcbY

Pride is about affirming the dignity and worth in everyone ‚Äî no matter who they love or how they identify.

Today and every day, I'm proud to stand shoulder to shoulder with the LGBTQ+ community as we fight for true equality.

¬†

For your extraordinary courage and selflessness, we salute you.

All that matters to them is that he failed.

If we end the filibuster, we can strengthen voting rights, pass universal background checks, raise the minimum wage, and more.
 
We can protect our democracy, and we can make progress on the urgent issues Americans elected us to address.
 
Let's get it done. End the filibuster.

Eliminating the filibuster won't mean the end of minority views.
 
That's what our system of checks and balances is for.
 
But a filibuster that has frozen our ability to pass overwhelmingly popular reforms isn‚Äôt a healthy check and balance ‚Äì
 
It‚Äôs a roadblock to progress.

Simply put, America is at a tipping point. 

It‚Äôs not tenable for the will of the majority of the voters to be continually thwarted by an archaic rule.

We need to end the filibuster so we can protect and strengthen our democracy.

So we can make progress ‚Äî and make it lasting.

The filibuster has a shameful legacy:
 
In the 1960s, segregationists used it to block civil rights legislation, including anti-lynching laws.
 
And today, Republicans are using it block progress on everything from preventing gun violence to protecting voting rights, and more.

The filibuster is an arcane Senate rule requiring 60 votes instead of a simple majority to end debate on a piece of legislation and bring it to a vote.

And while the filibuster has a long history, it's not written in the Constitution.

Here's why we should end it:

Senate Republicans blocked the creation of a bipartisan commission to investigate the January 6 insurrection, despite the fact that a majority of Senators ‚Äî and a majority of Americans ‚Äî support it.
 
How? Two words: The filibuster.
 
THREAD:

Republicans aren't being honest about the Jan. 6 commission.
¬†
It's bipartisan, with equal members from both parties. Subpoenas require a bipartisan vote. We agreed to Republicans' 2021 deadline.
¬†
Their sham complaints distract from the real motive:
¬†
To hide the truth.

As we monitor devastating reports of another mass shooting in San Jose, my heart goes out to the victims and their loved ones.
¬†
How much longer will we force every American to live in fear they'll be gunned down at work, at school, at the store?
¬†
It doesn't have to be this way.

This week:
¬†
An American journalist was detained in Myanmar. Belarus hijacked a commercial flight to detain a journalist. And an Uzbek blogger was arrested on trumped-up extortion charges.

The free press is critical to global democracy‚Äîand it‚Äôs under assault. We must protect it.

Marjorie Taylor Greene made herself a GOP star.
¬†
By creating chaos for clicks. Seeking money using racist, homophobic, antisemitic language. Spewing nonsense and hate.

Her actions are only a sign of the greater rot in her party.
¬†
It won‚Äôt stop until people stop rewarding them.

The lengths that autocrats will go to destroy the free press are clear.

Even forcing down an international flight in order to arrest a journalist.

The international condemnation must be swift and strong. This cannot stand. https://t.co/DUTj31NaBf

¬†

Investigating it must be a bipartisan imperative.

Make no mistake: We will have a full accounting. With or without them.

He doesn‚Äôt want to disclose what he discussed with Trump that day.

"There's no evidence this was an armed insurrection"
‚ÄúYou would actually think it was a normal tourist visit"

We've got a choice to make:
¬†
Do we want a historic investment in families and infrastructure? A modern green economy that lifts everyone up?

¬†
It‚Äôs really that simple. I know my answer.

Is there one among you who will say 'enough'?

Romney voted his conscience and was booed. Cheney refused to echo Trump's Big Lie and was ousted.

Soon there will be no one left in Trump‚Äôs GOP to speak the truth.

¬†
@POTUS has worked to remove DeJoy, but Senate Republicans are blocking any progress.
¬†
We rely on a strong USPS. It‚Äôs past time for DeJoy to go.

¬†
Because they‚Äôre now the party of lies, with one lie bigger than the rest.
¬†
She stated a simple fact: The election was not stolen.
¬†
In a party that places loyalty to Trump over principle, there is no room for the truth.

It will be our last Mother‚Äôs Day before Eli goes to college and we have an empty nest. Wish us luck!

Happy Mother‚Äôs Day! https://t.co/s0MtfgZX6f
